WORKSHOP with IZABELLA ORZELSKI - Impressionist Landscapes

This workshop is designed to explore Impressionism techniques in landscape painting. Using oils and acrylics, you will learn how to use a primer to enhance your painting and the steps to capture the essence of the depicted scene. Aside of brushes, you will use a palette knife to create texture and expressive mark making. You will become familiar with use atmospheric perspective to create a sense of depth. This workshop is designed for beginner to intermediate level artists.

SEPTEMBER 7 AND 8, 2024 9:30 to 4:00 pm

Members: $140 Non Members: $180

Bring your own Lunch!

WORKSHOP with RYAN KURYLO - SCULPTING

Discover the art of sculpting expressive faces in this hands-on workshop with

natural pottery clay. Delve into the world of emotional storytelling as we learn to

form and shape facial features that convey a range of feelings. Guided by your

passionate instructor, you will explore the nuances of expression, joy, sorrow,

surprise, and more. Through step-by-step demonstrations, participants will

master basic sculpting techniques, emphasizing the creation of lively and

evocative faces. This workshop is designed for all skill levels, fostering a

supportive and creative environment where each artist can infuse their unique emotions into the clay, resulting in a truly expressive and personalized sculpture.

September 10, 17, 24, 2024 - 12 noon to 5 pm.

Members: $140 Non Members $180

Bring Your Own Lunch! Supply List on Line.

Workshop - with Carleen Ross -

Coaching for the Creative is designed to help the participants acquire the knowledge of how to make more meaningful posts, create more personal artist statements, learn ways to run their business and engage with galleries or businesses through their innate strengths and values.

The material or this workshop comes through the lens of Positive Psychology and is crafted to suit any level of artist or creative. It wil be interactive, and with each learning segment, there will be exercises for the participant to dive deeper into understanding who they are and want to be as an artist.

Positive Psychology is the science of what is right with an individual and has the sole purpose of promoting well-being. It is used in many different industries with success. Positive psychology can create a lasting change for anyone open to exploring themselves in a new way.

Saturday, September 28 - 10:00 am to 2:30 pm

Members: $70 Non Members $90

Bring your own lunch!

WORKSHOP WITH DAVID SHKOLNY - Pastels

Learn the fundamentals of working with soft (chalk) pastels by creating two landscapes using two different kinds of paper. Start with a solid drawing then layer down the luscious colours of pastel

Workshop with Francis Marte - Hyper Realism Watercolors

Are you ready to make a dent in the world of watercolours? This workshop is designed to explore various techniques for you to apply for similar future paintings. Guided by a reference photo, the instructor will demo step-by-step on how to achieve this realistic, maritimes scene.

In this workshop, you will learn:

1. How to choose a good composition and reference photo

2. How to trace or draw the reference photo on watercolour paper

3. How to prep your painting – stretching paper perfectly, mounting paper on board and choosing the materials for mounting

4. How to analyze your reference photo to identify what techniques, colour pigments and other materials to use

5. Materials list – the instructor will provide the recommended materials (paints, paper, brushes, palette, masking fluid, etc.) and explain the functions and properties of each material, and substitutes

6. How to apply masking fluid

7. How to mix various pigments with water and other pigments to achieve interesting washes and textures for this painting

8. How to paint the first layers – blues and yellows

9. How to paint the second layers – shadows and darker values

10. How to pay attention to value and tone and compare with the reference photo

11. How to paint more layers on the darker values – identify what various pigments can be used and how to layer them using wet-on-wet technique

12. How to meticulously paint details

13. How to paint water ripples and reflections

14. How to correct mistakes, check for accuracy and cleanliness

Marte Poster.pdf

Marte Supply List 2024.pdf

The instructor has carefully timed this workshop for 5.5 hours, with a half hour break at noon. A material list is in a separate document. Instructions for trace transferring the photo reference on the watercolour paper will be sent two weeks before the workshop starts. Students will bring the watercolour paper in class with the drawing on the paper ready. Students can also arrive 30 mins before to trace transfer, with instructor’s assistance. It is recommended that students gather around the instructor during demos, but the instructor will also walk around to check on students’ progress and answer questions.

NOVEMBER 3, 2024 ....9:30 AM TO 4 PM

Members $70.00 Non Members: $90.00

WORKSHOP with JOYCE BOYER - ACRYLICS

Ever wonder how did they do that? We are going to dive into the area of Mixed Media. In this workshop we will be exploring the idea of painting on tissue and applying it to canvas…then let’s go even further. We will be using glazes and veils to create our piece allowing the painted tissue to come through. Then let’s go even further into our creation (using the wood substrate) we will be adding more to it to allow our work a 3-D texture . Bring your own reference material or use the instructors. The possibilities are endless.

NOVEMBER 23 AND 24, 2024 - 9:30 am to 4:00 pm

Members: $140 Non Members; $180
